column4: Anyone know what cpufreq method is actually being used on Jaunty? It seems to keep my cpu stuck on lowest frequency, even when I select the performance governor in the gnome applet
that shows the governor as set, but the scaling doesnt change (acual mhz/ghz)
it's hard to see because it changes so fast
it says performance, but the scaling__cur_freq sits at 800mhz (which sucks for a 2ghz laptop plugged into mains)
I use ondemand on my core2 quad desktop. I have cpufrequtils installed, which provides a cpufreq-set program.
I tried installing that, but then gnome failed to login - some sort of clash with the builtin power tools? It didnt seem to let me change anything either though
hmm I don't know, maybe you can just disable scaling?
google seems to think removing powernowd
but its not installed on my box
you could try unloading the module listed by cpufreq-info -d
I dont see any kernel modules - it must be builtin on jaunty
apparently gnome-power-manager might be handling it
maybe i should be filing a but against gnome-power-manager then
